place.name: COLTISHALL
place.gazetteerText: COLTISHALL, a parish in Aylsham district, Norfolk; on the river Bure, 2½ miles E of the line of projected railway from Norwich to Cromer, and 8 NNE of Norwich. It has a post office‡ under Norwich, and a fair on Whit-Monday. Acres, 1, 180. Real property, £4, 322. Pop., 978. Houses, 216. The property is divided among a few. Coltishall House is a chief residence. Many small cottages have recently been built. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £299.* Patron, King's College, Cambridge. The church is good; and there are three Methodist chapels, and an endowed school with £21 a year. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
